intro: Polystichum hubeiense, commonly known as Hubei shield fern, is a species of fern native to China. It belongs to the family Dryopteridaceae and is characterized by its dark green, leathery fronds with a distinctive shield-shaped outline. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its spores are produced on the underside of the fronds, and it plays a role in maintaining soil stability in its native habitat. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance.
